intro: Osmorhiza brachypoda var. fraterna, commonly known as the California false indigo, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided leaflets, and it produces small, blue to purple flowers in early spring. The root system is fibrous and has been traditionally used in herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
